summary: This is an email chain from April 23, 2021, forwarding a notification from the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). It reports that on April 22, 2021, an individual named Enver Ruci attempted to visit Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn, claiming to be a legal visitor. The officer denied the visit and stated she had no information about him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the individual whom Enver Ruci attempted to visit at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn.

persons.name: Enver Ruci
persons.context: An individual who attempted to visit Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC on April 22, 2021, claiming to want a legal visit and presenting a New York State driver's license.

connections.description: Enver Ruci attempted to visit Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC, claiming to be a legal visitor.

events.title: Attempted Visit to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An individual named Enver Ruci attempted to visit Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn, claiming to be a legal visitor. The officer denied the visit.

keyFacts: On April 22, 2021, Enver Ruci attempted to visit Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC in Brooklyn, claiming to be a legal visitor.
The officer at the MDC denied Ruci's visit, stating she had no information about him.
Ruci's information was obtained from his New York State driver's license, listing an address in Staten Island, New York.
The incident was reported by the U.S. Marshals Service to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on April 23, 2021.
